The article was published on the website: tc.com, which had previously published similar articles with changed details to match other cities.
The articles were shared around 1: 000 times on Facebook, according to social media monitoring tool CrowdTangle.
Multiple police departments: including the Philadelphia Police Department, the Omaha Police Department, and the Wichita Police Department, denied the incidents mentioned in the article.
In contrast to the false claim: there were actual foiled mass shooting attempts in the US during mid-August 2019, as reported by USA Today, involving arrests in Connecticut, Florida, and Ohio.
